context:
Publication Number 740-00067B
1900402
NQ-SYSCTRL 
System Controller 
Installation and Use
The System Controller provides a cost-effective way 
to deploy Nyquist based solutions using a state-of-
the-art processing platform pre-installed with the 
Nyquist application server software. The System 
Controller offers high-performance operation for 
even the largest Nyquist system configurations and 
can simultaneously distribute an unlimited number 
of audio streams anywhere across the network, 
making it perfect for background music applications.
The System Controller can manage applications 
that require any mix of multi-zone paging, intercom
calling, or background music distribution at 
businesses, restaurants, retail stores, industrial 
facilities, and many other venues.  It has a web-
based graphical user interface (GUI) that is 
accessible from almost any personal computer (PC), 
tablet, or mobile device. 

The System Controller is designed to run on a 
10/100 Ethernet network.

qas.question: What type of applications can the System Controller manage?

answers.text: The System Controller can manage applications that require any mix of multi-zone paging, intercom calling, or background music distribution. It is suitable for various venues such as businesses, restaurants, retail stores, and industrial facilities.

qas.question: How does the System Controller distribute audio streams?

answers.text: The System Controller distributes audio streams over a 10/100 Ethernet network, allowing for high-performance operation and simultaneous distribution of an unlimited number of audio streams across the network. It can manage multi-zone paging, intercom calling, and background music applications in various venues through a web-based graphical user interface accessible on PCs, tablets, or mobile devices.

qas.question: What kind of network does the System Controller require for operation?

answers.text: The System Controller requires a 10/100 Ethernet network for operation. It is designed to handle high-performance audio streaming and management across various applications and venues.

qas.question: What is the primary software pre-installed on the System Controller?

answers.text: The primary software pre-installed on the System Controller is the Nyquist application server software. This enables high-performance operation and facilitates the management of audio streaming applications across various venues.

qas.question: On what types of devices can the System Controller's GUI be accessed?

answers.text: The System Controller's GUI can be accessed from almost any personal computer (PC), tablet, or mobile device.

qas.question: In what types of environments is the System Controller typically used?

answers.text: The System Controller is typically used in environments such as businesses, restaurants, retail stores, industrial facilities, and other venues that require multi-zone paging, intercom calling, or background music distribution. Its flexibility and high-performance capabilities make it suitable for various audio streaming applications.

qas.question: Does the System Controller support multi-zone paging and intercom calling?

answers.text: Yes, the System Controller manages applications that require multi-zone paging and intercom calling, making it suitable for various settings such as businesses and restaurants. It offers high-performance operation for large Nyquist system configurations.

qas.question: What is the benefit of using the System Controller for background music applications?

answers.text: The System Controller enables seamless distribution of an unlimited number of audio streams across the network, making it ideal for background music applications in various venues. Its high-performance capability ensures effective management of multi-zone paging and intercom calling alongside music distribution, all accessible through a user-friendly web-based GUI.

context:
NQ-SYSCTRL System Controller Installation 
The System Controller can be shelf, wall, or rack 
mounted.
1.	 Either place the System Controller appliance on 
a shelf, or use the supplied mounting ears to 
mount it on a wall. For rack mounting, use one 
of the available optional rack mount kits (NQ-
RMK02, NQ-RMK03 or NQ-RMK04) as applicable.
2.	 Connect the device to the 10/100 network using 
a CAT5 type cable. 

3.	 Connect the power cord to the back of the unit. 

4.	 If connecting auxiliary devices, such as a keyboard, mouse, or video monitor, connect the 
devices’ cables to the appropriate connectors on 
the back of the device.

If connecting a video monitor, make sure to use 
the HDMI video output as the Digital Video Interface (DVI) output is not supported.  Use of the 
RS232 ports is  also not supported.
5.	 Toggle the Power switch to the On position.
Once the System Controller is powered on and connected to the network, it can be accessed and 
configured via the device’s web-based GUI.  There 
are two IP addresses available to access the web-
based GUI: 1) a default static IP (192.168.1.10) on 
Ethernet Port A and 2) Dynamic Host Configuration 
Protocol (DHCP) on Ethernet Port B. 

NOTE:  You must have a valid software 
license activation key to set up and configure 

Viewing and 
Understanding the POWER LED of the NQ-SYSCTRL System Controller
An LED labeled POWER appears on the front of the 
System Controller. This LED appears solid green 
when the device is powered on.
Using the Reset Button
The Reset button reboots the System 
Controller and launches the logon 
screen.

qas.question: What mounting options are available for the System Controller appliance?

answers.text: The System Controller appliance can be mounted on a shelf, wall-mounted using supplied mounting ears, or rack-mounted using optional rack mount kits (NQ-RMK02, NQ-RMK03, or NQ-RMK04).

qas.question: Which type of cable should be used to connect the System Controller to the network?

answers.text: To connect the System Controller to the network, a CAT5 type cable should be used.

qas.question: What should be done if auxiliary devices like a keyboard or mouse need to be connected?

answers.text: If auxiliary devices like a keyboard or mouse need to be connected, plug the devices’ cables into the appropriate connectors on the back of the System Controller. However, note that RS232 ports are not supported for any auxiliary connections.

qas.question: Which output should be used for connecting a video monitor to the System Controller?

answers.text: The HDMI video output should be used for connecting a video monitor to the System Controller, as the Digital Video Interface (DVI) output is not supported. The RS232 ports are also not supported for video connection.

qas.question: What two methods of IP address configuration are available for accessing the web-based GUI?

answers.text: Two methods of IP address configuration available for accessing the web-based GUI are: 1) a default static IP address of 192.168.1.10 on Ethernet Port A, and 2) Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) on Ethernet Port B.

qas.question: What is indicated by a solid green POWER LED on the System Controller?

answers.text: A solid green POWER LED on the System Controller indicates that the device is powered on and functioning properly.

qas.question: What function does the Reset button perform on the System Controller?

answers.text: The Reset button on the System Controller reboots the device and launches the logon screen. This function allows for a quick restart without needing to power off the unit completely.

qas.question: Is a software license activation key required for setting up the System Controller?

answers.text: Yes, a valid software license activation key is required to set up and configure the NQ-SYSCTRL System Controller. Without it, the device cannot be properly configured through the web-based GUI.

qas.question: What should be used for rack mounting the System Controller?

answers.text: For rack mounting the System Controller, one of the available optional rack mount kits (NQ-RMK02, NQ-RMK03, or NQ-RMK04) should be used as applicable.

qas.question: Where on the device can the power cord be connected?

answers.text: The power cord can be connected to the back of the NQ-SYSCTRL System Controller unit.
